intro: Pleiocarpa mutica, commonly known as the hairy pleiocarpa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its dispersal in the wild.
